reviewText: seems every test now requires reading, but i have been finding these dvds cover what she's already learned in 3rd by the end of the year.

Word problems have been a problem for people for years.  The trick is pulling out what you need to know to solve the problem. This dvd has taken that anxiety away from my girls who are in the 2nd and 5th grade. As a mom, I have to make study and homework fun and as stress free as possible so it's a positive experience. Rock and Learn products help me with this quite a bit. I don't mind spending money on these dvd's at all.
This video helped my child so much!!!! It's outdated because it says 3rd and 4th grade they need to update to 2nd grade!!! But I have a few of these videos and they are a great help!!
This DVD really helped my child better understand and prepare for math tests in 3rd grade.  Good variety of material that kept him engaged.  Practice tests and quizzes were nice too.

This video is boring and does not even teach word problems as it states it does, just regular math problems.  I was hoping to teach my students things like make a list, act it out, etc.  Essentially, you watch a standardized test taken and videotaped -snoozer.  "Rock" and Learn has no music either.

This DVD was both entertaining and informative. My son enjoyed the presentation and watches it for pleasure.  He quickly grasped the concepts.  It helped boost his confidence in testing. Highly recommend.
Our house is always full of music so this has been great to add to it.  Makes learing so much more fun.  We have fun while we learn.

Would recommend.
Kids love it.

Great review for younger to middle school kids. I teach Special Education Resource and Inclusion and have used this for 3rd- 6th grade. Print off the resources from Marko the Pencil and go.

Be ready! The kids really like Marko, as he is a pretty funny pencil. :)
THE KIDS LOVE IT AND THEY ARE LEARNING AS WELL. TRULY EDUTAINMENT
Thanks my son is very happy
I own the enter collection and as been buying them since my son was in 1st grade
It's an excellent teaching tool.
My 5 year old eats these "Marco the Pencil" dvd's up. I thought they'd be beyond her level, but she's constantly asking to watch them. She's learning a lot too!
cool.
